summary: Creates plots of denoised copy ratios

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Input file containing denoised copy ratios (output of DenoiseReadCounts).
arguments.name: --denoised-copy-ratios

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Maximum copy ratio to be plotted. If Infinity, the maximum copy ratio will be automatically determined.
arguments.name: --maximum-copy-ratio

arguments.summary: Threshold length (in bp) for contigs to be plotted. Contigs with lengths less than this threshold will not be plotted. This can be used to filter out mitochondrial contigs, unlocalized contigs, etc.
arguments.name: --minimum-contig-length

arguments.summary: Output directory.  This will be created if it does not exist.
arguments.name: --output

arguments.summary: Prefix for output filenames.
arguments.name: --output-prefix

arguments.summary: Point size to use for plotting copy-ratio points.
arguments.name: --point-size-copy-ratio

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: File containing a sequence dictionary, which specifies the contigs to be plotted and their relative lengths. The sequence dictionary must be a subset of those contained in other input files. Contigs will be plotted in the order given. Contig names should not include the string "CONTIG_DELIMITER". The tool only considers contigs in the given dictionary for plotting, and data for contigs absent in the dictionary generate only a warning. In other words, you may modify a reference dictionary for use with this tool to include only contigs for which plotting is desired, and sort the contigs to the order in which the plots should display the contigs.
arguments.name: --sequence-dictionary

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: Input file containing standardized copy ratios (output of DenoiseReadCounts).
arguments.name: --standardized-copy-ratios

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Creates plots of standardized and denoised copy ratios. The tool also generates various denoising metrics.

Inputs

  • Standardized-copy-ratios from DenoiseReadCounts.
  • Denoised-copy-ratios from DenoiseReadCounts.
  • Sequence-dictionary file. This determines the order and representation of contigs in the plot.
  • Output prefix. This is used as the basename for output files.
  • Output directory. This will be created if it does not exist.

Outputs

  • Denoised-plot file. A plot showing both the standardized and denoised copy ratios is output. Copy ratios are only plotted up to the maximum value specified by the argument maximum-copy-ratio. Point size can be specified by the argument point-size-copy-ratio.
  • Median-absolute-deviation files. These files contain the median absolute deviation (MAD) for both the standardized (.standardizedMAD.txt) and denoised (.denoisedMAD.txt) copy ratios, the change between the two (.deltaMAD.txt), and the change between the two scaled by the standardized MAD (.deltaScaledMAD.txt).

Usage examples

     gatk PlotDenoisedCopyRatios \
          --standardized-copy-ratios tumor.standardizedCR.tsv \
          --denoised-copy-ratios tumor.denoisedCR.tsv \
          --sequence-dictionary contigs_to_plot.dict \
          --output-prefix tumor \
          -O output_dir
name: PlotDenoisedCopyRatios
